availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

creation.placeName: New York City, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City & County of New York } SS

Henry C. Banks, being duly sworn deposeth and saith that "he will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of his station" as Commissioner of Deeds for Kentucky in and for the State of New York in the City of New York that the seal and c and impression of which is hereto annexed is adopted by him as his official seal as such commissioner
Dated at the City of New York this 13th day of November A D 1862.

Henry C. Banks
Commr for Ky
Sworn to and subscribed before me this 13th day of Nov 1862

G. W. Steinbrenner
Notary Public
City and County of New York
G. W. STEINBRENNER
NOTARY
PUBLIC
NEW-YORK

New York
Oath
Henry C. Banks
Filed Decr 27 1862
